title: PKCS#11 issue
content:
Hi there,

I have recently updated my macOS to Catalina version 10.15.7. At the same time I suscribed to a vpn service. Now I have been getting these very annoying pop up windows every two minutes:

Password Required - Mozilla Firefox Please enter the password for the PKCS#11 token (username): [Blank field to enter a password]

Questions: 1) Do I need to enter any password or is there a specific password it is looking for? 2) I realize this is for some kind of certificates. I am not a sophisticated user (have private vpn and work vpn) and mostly watch videos, surf the net, do some online shopping, etc. Do I really need this? 3) If I unload it (via Settings/Privacy & Security, etc.) will it screw anything up?

This never happened before I updated to Catalina or signed up for a private VPN.

Your help is greatly appreciated.

title: Firefix is using Hardware acceleration with hardware acceleration disabled
content:
Hey,

I am using Firefox 89.0 on Microsoft Server 2019 RDS Farm. The Server is a VM Virtualized with VMWare. I have the Problem that Firefox freezed on some Websites so I deactivated the hardware accerlation because I just have graphical software encoding on my server.

But disabling it did not helped. Starting Firefox in Debug mode everything worked fine. No freezes at all. After checking this I realized that firefox is still using Hardware accerlation and is ignoring my settings.

You can find my export of my About:support page here: https://pastebin.com/1hXCfMwB I also added an Image with my settings of my hardware acceleration.

If I create a new Firefox Profile the settings are being used for a day. I also tried to clear the pref.js out of the profile with no success.

This problem is already happening since version 82.0 Other settings like Startpage or something are working fine.

If you need further Informations please let me know. I hope someone have a Solution for me.

Best Regards Alex

title: Firefox 90 Fonts
content:
I changed my Windows 10 default font to something other than Segoe UI because I very much dislike Segoe UI. My doing so also changed the default font in Firefox 88, which is what I wanted. When I updated to Firefox 89, the browser no longer used my Windows 10 default font. That disappointed me a great deal because I did not like the font that Firefox 89 used. When Firefox 89.01 was released, that fixed the problem, and the browser used my Windows 10 default font, which again, is what I wanted.

I have now updated to Firefox 90, and it is not using my Windows 10 default font. Instead, it is using the ugly font that Firefox 89 used. In the Firefox 89.01 Release Notes, it says one of the issues that got fixed was "Fix various font related regressions (bug 1694174)" I am not sure if that is the "fix" that allowed Firefox 89.01 to use my Windows 10 default font, but I do know that after that fix, Firefox used my preferred font.

At bottom, Firefox 90 is not using my preferred font, which is the same problem Firefox 89 had and that Firefox 89.01 corrected. Please fix Firefox 90 so I am not stuck with the ugly font that it uses.

title: Do Not Remove Proton Preferences
content:
The update to FF 89 caused a big problem. Large spaces in between the bookmarked web sites when the window unfolds. So now, many bookmarks don't fit in the window, and to get to the bottom - the ones I can't see - I have to click the arrow at the bottom. But making it worse, is that if I do go to the bottom, the next time I open the bookmark tab, the list will open at the bottom (it doesn't revert to the top). So I'd have to scroll up to get to the ones at the top - AND the "Other Bookmarks" tab, where I also store bookmarked sites.

I list my bookmarks in the order they're in so I can get to the ones I go to most often as fast as possible. So they're at the top - I don't have to scroll far to get to them. And the "Other Bookmarks" is hidden when the window opens at the bottom. So I'd have to scroll up to get to that as well.

Also, this update changed the size of the command windows - like the copy/paste window, or the window to get the correct spelling of the word. They're so big, they run from the top of the screen to bottom, instead of a small square. So you'll have to scroll way up to get to the command or word you want.

I did find a way to get it back to what it was:

1. Open a tab and enter about:config, click OK after the warning 2. Search proton, a few will come up, change all the ones that are true to false. One was already false so I kept it, and the last one had a 3, which I kept. 3. Exit and open FF.

This will also revert the right-click command boxes back to small squares.

I posted this on this message board but this was added:

==WARNING: There are plans to remove this preference in the next two months The preference setting was created as a toggle for developers when building the new design. Now that the new interface has shipped, the preference will be removed.

If you have any issues with the new design, please let us know what it is you don't like, and we can try provide more permanent solutions depending on the issue.==

No! Do NOT remove this preference! Either that or just get it back to what it was by default. I do not want longer bookmark menus and larger command windows. It was perfect the way it was.

title: Вкладки в браузере ебут мозги, в тупую не загружаются оставляя страницу не прогруженной(блять).
content: Как вы можете мне помочь? Я сам не знаю. Сама проблема в том, что открываешь сайт(любой сайт, вообще без разницы) и ничего не происходит, новая вкладка конечно открывается, но дальше ниче не происходит при этом в адресной строке сама ссылка есть и все равно ничего не происходит... Проблема решается конечно просто, просто сиди и обновляй страницу, однако спешу сообщить сие действие тупое, так как зависит от твоей удачи на сей день(ебать меня в сраку). Аргумент, вот сижу я и листаю ленту, да?, в общем хочу музыку послушать и, естественно, открываю спотифай чтобы словить расслабон, но там парил на поверхности воды огромный болт! Мне пришлось обновлять чертов спотифай точка ком на протяжении 10 минут, послушать музыку, я человек простой и после данного инцидента начал материться и материть огненную лисицу, а в частности их программистов, не предусмотревших такой казус. В тот день я так и не смог послушать свою музыку... Насчет браузера стоит он у меня на ПК уже порядка 3-4 лет, такой головки от члена не было в начале моего опыта с браузером. Последний год или полтора года это случается со мной ЕЖЕДНЕВНО и я крайне недоволен, это очень обидная вещь рушащая мое очко. Интересный факт, сам этот баг случается всегда после очистки кэша, что очень надоедает, потому что кэш очищается регулярно. Надеюсь что это хоть кто-нибудь прочитает и услышит мою печаль. И очень, очень надеюсь что мой высер никто не удалит(because its on russian we should delete it, yeah great plan pal) и помогут с данной проблемой, ведь именно это каждый день трахать меня в очко без смазки бесплатно без регистрации и смс. Динар(честно не додик), 16 лет.

content:
Hi!

Please give me some tips and tricks on how to block third party trackers while using and browsing on mozilla. Because there is lots of important information on my laptop. Please guide me, also National Son Day on this day I got tracked.
creator: thenextdayby

title: non-responding website
content:
I am trying to login to a bank website. Before the latest update, this was no problem. Now the website just sits there and nothing is happening. When I use the same login on Safari, the website responds.

I am using an iMac running 10.13 OS. My FF is updated to 89.0.2.

Please respond ASAP, as I need to be able to get into the account fairly regularly.

Pat N.
creator: wwplyr
